== Main Inclusion Report for kpackagekit ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/k/kpackagekit]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Needed by Kubuntu 
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=kpackagekit|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=kpackagekit|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: none
** Does not include binaries running as root and daemons
** Network activity: does not open ports or handle incoming data, that is handled by python-apt
** Does not directly (not through a library) process binary (video, audio, etc) or structured (PDF, etc) data
** No known source code review performed
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Always works out of the box without configuration
** No debconf questions
** Not in Debian
** <nowiki>[[http://www.packagekit.org/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** <nowiki>[[http://tinyurl.com/2s4tnt|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: busy
** Hardware: Does not deal with
** No test suite included
 0. ''UI standards:''
** User-visible strings are internationalized using standard gettext system
** .pot is built
** End user applications have .desktop file
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards compliant
** Packaging system cdbs, quilt
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** packagekit not yet in main
 0. ''Maintenance:''
** Package is likely to need a fair amount of maintenance
** Kubuntu team and Sebastian Heinlein are responsible for maintenance
 0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file.
** Upstream call it kpackagekit
